info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 12:08PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Showers with heavy rain will impact portions of south central Cumberland, southeastern Prince Edward, northeastern Lunenburg, Nottoway and southwestern Amelia Counties through 100 PM EDT... At 1206 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking showers with heavy rain along a line extending from near Hampden Sydney College to Kenbridge. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Rain 1 to 2 inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Possible minor flooding of low lying and poor drainage areas. Showers will be near... Hampden Sydney College and Hampden Sydney around 1210 PM EDT. Burkeville around 1220 PM EDT. Longwood University around 1225 PM EDT. Farmville around 1230 PM EDT. Rice around 1235 PM EDT. Blackstone, Nottoway and Guinea Mills around 100 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these showers include Raines Tavern, Irby, Prince Edward Station, Angola, Murdocks, Twin Lakes State Park, Nutbush, The Falls, Hawk and Fergusonville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these showers and may lead to localized minor flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
